other_tests.findings: Biopsy specimen of the hand showed parakeratosis, spongiosis, dermal edema, and collections of Langerhans cells in the epidermis.

Reads at 48 and 72 hours were significant for reactions to formaldehyde, quaternium-15, nickel sulfate, diazolidinyl urea, DMDM hydantoin in petroleum base, DMDM hydantoin in aqueous solution, imidazolidinyl urea, MCI/MI, palladium chloride, and ethyleneureamelamine-formaldehyde.
other_tests.changes_over_time: All cases cleared or markedly improved when the patients stopped using baby wipes, or switched types based on their sensitivities. None of the patients required further treatment by 2 months of follow-up.

other_tests.findings: Microscopic examination revealed acanthosis, spongiosis, and interstitial and perivascular dermal eosinophilic infiltrates.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Her condition initially improved, but flared once her oral steroid was tapered. Her steroid course was extended with resolution of her rash.
